data.title: Plants vs Zombies - Squash
data.statement:
In Plants vs Zombies, consider a simple scenario where there are {{9}} tiles in total (1x9 grid).

All zombies spawn on tile {{9}} at the start. They walk forward at various speeds, measured in tiles per second. Zombie positions are updated <<ONCE per second>>.

A squash can squash zombies in a {{1x1}} area. Once <<any>> zombie has walked {{7 or more}} tiles and gets within the first two tiles, the squash activates, and destroys the frontmost zombie and all zombies that are within 1 tile behind that zombie at that moment.

The squash activates only <<ONCE per game>>, and then it will die along with the zombies it squashes.

<<EXAMPLE:>>
Input:
2
1.0
0.98

Output:
DEAD 0.14

There are 2 zombies traveling at 1.0 and 0.98 tiles / second respectively.
After 7 seconds the 1st zombie will be on the 2nd tile, and the squash will kill both, the distance between the nearest and furthest 0.14 tiles.
data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read speed:float
write DEAD or ALIVE
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of zombies
<<Next [[N]] lines>>: A float [[speed]] for a given zombie in tiles per second
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> {{ALIVE}} and number of alive zombies or {{DEAD}} and the distance between the nearest and furthest zombie <<rounded to {{2}} decimal places>>. The word and the value should be <<space separated>>

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

In Plants vs Zombies, consider a simple scenario where there are 9 tiles in total (1x9 grid).

All zombies spawn on tile 9 at the start. They walk forward at various speeds, measured in tiles per second. Zombie positions are updated ONCE per second.

A squash can squash zombies in a 1x1 area. Once any zombie has walked 7 or more tiles and gets within the first two tiles, the squash activates, and destroys the frontmost zombie and all zombies that are within 1 tile behind that zombie at that moment.

The squash activates only ONCE per game, and then it will die along with the zombies it squashes.

EXAMPLE:
Input:
2
1.0
0.98

Output:
DEAD 0.14

There are 2 zombies traveling at 1.0 and 0.98 tiles / second respectively.
After 7 seconds the 1st zombie will be on the 2nd tile, and the squash will kill both, the distance between the nearest and furthest 0.14 tiles.
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of zombies
Next N lines: A float speed for a given zombie in tiles per second
Output
Line 1: ALIVE and number of alive zombies or DEAD and the distance between the nearest and furthest zombie rounded to 2 decimal places. The word and the value should be space separated
Constraints
0 < N < 100
0.0 < speed <= 5.0
Example
Input
2
1.0
0.98
Output
DEAD 0.14
